comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: A devastating earthquake struck both Turkey and Syria last Monday, in a humanitarian catastrophe that the two countries had not witnessed in decades. According to the latest news of the victims issued today by international news agencies, the death toll exceeded 26,000 dead on both sides, in addition to the collapse of more than 6,000 buildings and the displacement of no less than 5 million people. It is a human tragedy by all accounts.As usual, the countries of the world mobilized to provide assistance to the affected people, since the two countries are already suffering from economic difficulties.Turkey has been living in an economic crisis since years, and it is hardly trying to save its economy in light of many international variables, including the global energy crisis after the outbreak of the Ukrainian war. The elections are close in Turkey, and the earthquake will certainly affect the results of the vote, in light of the accusations of the Turkish government of failing to rescue and compensate those affected.Syria has already been suffering from a civil war for 12 years, and its economy cannot bear such environmental disasters, especially since the country has been living under Western sanctions since the outbreak of the war, and there are no real capabilities that can be relied upon.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Quote from: Newlifebtc on February 13, 2023, 10:56:03 PMDiscount tackle and country always experience earthquake in their region so sometimes I began to ask what is the things that really cause this earthquake in their region is it that the place is being polluted or is being excavated or is being drained with a dredger so I don't understand why some area of this particular country or always experience earthquake in their environmentsHave you ever heard about thing called tectonic plates? Turkey and Syria is located in crossroads of 3 tectonic plates - Anatolian, Arabian, and African plates. They touch and interact with each other and it's tectonically active area. Unfortunately, this region always will be at risk of earthquake, and there is not much what human can do to. Here more detailed article explaining it:https://www.bu.edu/articles/2023/two-earthquakes-turkey-syria-predicted/Countries located in such dangerous regions should follow Japan example. They have very strict requirement for buildings and it can withstand earthquakes. Even skyscrapers!

More people would've been saved had the rescue efforts started earlier and more organized. What happened is very sad but we'll overcome this.
